intro: Cheirodendron trigynum var. hawaiiense, commonly known as the Hawaiian cheirodendron, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded habitats on the island of Hawaii. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment, supporting various insect and bird species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and valuable component of Hawaii's botanical diversity.
